title: internal compiler error when inferring `_` type for Associated Type bound

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

labels.name: T-types
labels.description: Relevant to the types team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Rust compiler error for simple code like this: ### Code [playaround](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=1059ed9242a9b0abf87e052667a17085) ```Rust trait Database: Restriction {} trait Restriction { type Inner; } struct Test {} impl Database for Test {} impl Restriction for Test { type Inner = u32; } fn main() { let t = Test {}; let x: &Database = &t; } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.48.0 (7eac88abb 2020-11-16) binary: rustc commit-hash: 7eac88abb2e57e752f3302f02be5f3ce3d7adfb4 commit-date: 2020-11-16 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.48.0 LLVM version: 11.0 ``` ### Error output ``` Compiling aaaa v0.1.0 (/Users/dudu/tmp/aaaa) warning: trait objects without an explicit `dyn` are deprecated --> src/main.rs:16:13 | 16 | let x: &Database = &t; | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: use `dyn`: `dyn Database` | = note: `#[warn(bare_trait_objects)]` on by default warning: unused variable: `x` --> src/main.rs:16:9 | 16 | let x: &Database = &t; | ^ help: if this is intentional, prefix it with an underscore: `_x` | = note: `#[warn(unused_variables)]` on by default warning: Error finalizing incremental compilation session directory `/Users/dudu/tmp/aaaa/target/debug/incremental/aaaa-3t9641te2lvvd/s-ftkew3bbem-6oinlz-working`: No such file or directory (os error 2) warning: 3 warnings emitted error: internal compiler error: broken MIR in DefId(0:10 ~ aaaa[fab6]::main) (CanonicalUserTypeAnnotation { user_ty: Canonical { max_universe: U0, variables: [CanonicalVarInfo { kind: Region(U0) }, CanonicalVarInfo { kind: Ty(General(U0)) }, CanonicalVarInfo { kind: Region(U0) }], value: Ty(&dyn Database) }, span: src/main.rs:16:12: 16:32 (#0), inferred_ty: &dyn Database }): bad user type (&dyn Database = &dyn Database): NoSolution | = note: delayed at compiler/rustc_mir/src/borrow_check/type_check/mod.rs:258:27 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:961:13 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.48.0 (7eac88abb 2020-11-16) running on x86_64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden error: could not compile `aaaa` To learn more, run the command again with --verbose. ```
Backtrace

``` ```
